intro: Oenothera beckeri, commonly known as the Becker's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oenothera beckeri is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primroses and related species. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
